revised_title: Photosynthetic Microbial Communities in Aquatic Ecosystems: Distribution, Adaptation, and Ecophysiological Mechanisms
tldr: This article discusses the distribution patterns and ecophysiological mechanisms of photosynthetic microbial communities in aquatic ecosystems. It highlights the importance of factors such as the nature of the photosynthetic apparatus, light quantity and quality, and the ability to adapt to different environments. The article also emphasizes the role of interfaces in the colonization of specialized neuston and benthic organisms.
scientific_discipline: Environmental and Earth Sciences > Aquatic Ecosystems
